snippet: After the shocking primary loss of Representative Eric Cantor, House Republicans will vote on their leadership on Thursday, but a bigger contest is months if not years away.
abstract: Congressional Memo; House Republicans will hold vote on new majority leader following shocking primary loss of Rep Eric Cantor; majority whip Kevin McCarthy is widely expected to ascend to position; vote belies longer struggle over coming months and years over who will become true heir apparent to House Speaker John A Boehner.
lead_paragraph: After the shocking primary loss of Representative Eric Cantor, House Republicans will vote on their leadership on Thursday, but a bigger contest is months if not years away.

headline.seo: After Cantor’s Loss, Bigger Republican Contest Is on the Horizon
headline.main: In House G.O.P.’s Leadership Fight, the Main Event Is Still to Come
headline.print_headline: In House G.O.P.’s Leadership Fight, the Main Event Is Still to Come
